She sure loves her daddy, huh? Annie smiles and looks herself. Yes, she does, she thinks can't I? Back to the others. Everyone is very interested in Robert stories... especially Tom.
... and I thought before I settled  into law school -- everybody knew that  was the plan -- I'd take this time for  myself. Grace rises to go to the Creek House.

And I tell you, Frank, it was one of  the -- As Grace passes by, she stumbles a bit and Robert habitua rises to help, but Grace ignores him and rights herself,  continuing. Robert quickly sits back down, continuing.

... one of the uh... greatest times  of my life... I had experiences that,  I think, changed my outlook forever.  I came back a different person,  literally. Tom listens with great interest and respect. Back to Diane and Annie, who watch as Joe follows Grace.
I think I'm going to have my hands  full with the son of mine when you  leave. Just might be his first  broken heart.
Oh, how sweet. A burst of laughter pulls their attention to the group -- Robert is now standing, acting out a story.

... and I have no idea what he's  saying because I don't understand  Hindu... Everyone is listening, with big expectant smiles. Annie  watches -- having heard this story before. Her eyes gradu shift to Tom, who is enjoying the story.

... So, finally I'm trying to explain  to him that I'm allergic to wool and  would he please get his sheep out of  my car -- Laughter. Robert continues, giving a quick look to Annie who is looking at Tom... Robert lets it go, continuing hi story.
Grace is asleep. Robert sits by her bed, lit by the moon  through a window. He stares at this creature he loves so  much. He rises and enters Annie's room.
Tired? Annie shrugs. Robert looks at the bed. He teases.
Small bed. Maybe I should sleep in  the barn.
(teases back)
You're allergic to hay.
(smiles)
I apologize for the surprise, but the  days only opened yesterday and I  figured...
You don't have to explain. You have  every right to come.
I can see why you put your faith in  him. He's a genuine... good guy...  Good at what he does. That's rare. Annie nods. She tries to hide her discomfort. Robert sits the bed before her.
You were right about coming here. I'm  sorry for not thinking...
No, it's okay. Believe me, there were  plenty of times I didn't know what  the hell was right.
How are you feeling about work?
Let's not talk about that now. And they're quiet. He moves to kiss her. It's awkward. Th look to each other -- as they try to remember how to make together...
I feel like I'm on a first date. Annie smiles sympathetically.

Cars and pick-up trucks haphazardly parked along a dirt  road... Smoking open grill barbecues. Ranchers and famili move about the ranch, sit and eat at picnic tables with  gingham tablecloths... Some teenagers hanging around the  corral, talking. Diane and some other women, eating and  talking... Frank with a group of men, drinking beer, tell stories. A BAND has been set up by the barn. People are dancing un the harvest moon. Grace is dancing with Joe... Tom is dan with a local woman... Annie with a rancher... Everyone is having a good time... Robert is enjoying a smoke with some men. He looks over t the dance floor and smiles when he sees Grace and Joe. Joe and the Rancher trade place... Joe dances with Annie, Rancher with Grace... But Tom sees his chance and switche with the Rancher so that he can dance with Grace... She i thrilled and he guides her effortlessly across the floor. Joe and Annie are interrupted by another couple. Joe swit partners, but Annie smiles and excuses herself -- she wan rest. Robert continues talking with some of the men. He puts ou his smoke and looks over to the dance floor. He sees Grac dancing with Tom... His eyes search for Annie. He moves a from the men until he sees, from a distance; Annie, sitting by herself, amidst the crowd... No one wou notice her unless they were looking for her... But Robert -- and what he sees is Annie looking at Grace and Tom... only looking at Tom... Smiling to herself gently... Watch his every move. Suddenly, she rises and exits out of the to get some air.
Annie finds an isolated spot, behind the main house, to b herself and catch her breath.

Tom and Grace continue dancing. She's in heaven. Robert  approaches and Tom quickly allows him to take over. Grace loves the attention from both men. As they dance off, Tom crosses the dance floor and is met by Hank's wife;
Oh Tom, would you check the shed and see  if there's anymore chairs.
Sure.

Tom is walking along when he turns the corner of Hank's h and finds; Annie sitting alone, staring up at the night. They see ea other. From behind the house, no one else can see them. It is as if the fates brought them face to face and alone Without any will to stop it, they embrace and kiss  passionately. But when they look into each other's eyes,  there is no joy in the kiss. Tom releases her and walks a heading for the shed. Annie quickly pulls herself togethe and enters the main house through the back door.

Diane is once more sitting at the kitchen table, looking some bills before bed. Her tape player is on softly. Tom  enters and crosses to the sink to get a glass of water. Diane looks up, seeing Tom with his back to her -- standi the sink, filling his glass -- staring out the window ove sink. She looks to the dish of brownies on the table.
I have some brownies left over. Want  one?
(w/o turning around)
No thanks. Diane senses an uneasiness in Tom. She looks as he drinks water. MEDIUM CLOSE-UP ON TOM'S BACK, as if from Diane's POV. But when we pull back we find ourselves;
Tom is standing in front of Pilgrim's stall. He opens the door. They look at each other. He strokes him and begins whisper;
There's something you have to do  tomorrow, boy... Camera gently moves away... and Tom whispers to Pilgrim w must be done...

There's a stillness. A sense of import. Annie, Robert, Fr Diane, Joe and Smokey, are all at various spots along the Grace stands inside the ring. Tom is standing beside Pilg in the middle of the ring. Pilgrim is bridled and saddled Tom adjusts he stirrup. He walks over to Grace...
All set? Grace swallows hard, nodding. She's worried...
Sure?
(softly)

Sure. Tom puts his arms around her shoulders and walks out to  Pilgrim. The horse pricks up his ears as they approach. T motions Grace to stop a short distance from Pilgrim so as to crowd him. Tom walks over alone, reaching to gently ta hold of him. Holding him by the bridle, he puts his head  beside Pilgrim's, quietly speaking to him, soothing Pilgr neck with his other hand... Annie and Robert are fascinated. Anxious. Pilgrim never takes his eyes off Grace. Tom tries to ease forward. Pilgrim resists, lifting his head and looking at Grace so you can see the white at the top of his eye. Tom turns him away, walking him in circles, trying to calm hi He leads him back to Grace. Pilgrim tosses his head and  stomps his feet. Robert grows more anxious. Annie is calmer, more focused. Tom climbs up on him, riding him around the arena in an e lope. Grace watches them go round the ring. She looks at parents and tries to smile. They try as well. Tom dismounts and leads Pilgrim back to Grace. Pilgrim ba again, violently throwing his head, kicking... Grace's  shoulders slump, she presses her hands in her pockets,  fighting not to cry...
Smokey... Smokey climbs over the rail into the ring as Tom says som to him. Meanwhile Frank reassures Grace:
He'll be okay, Grace. Just you hang  on there a minute or two. Tom'll get  him, okay, you'll see... Smokey jogs over to the gate, climbing it, and disappeari into the barn. Tom crosses to Grace.
There's still something going on  inside of him I can't reach. So me  and Smokey here, we're going to  try laying him down. Okay?
What does that mean?

It's more or less how it sounds.  Sometimes it's not pretty to watch.  Some horses fight it real hard.  Your fella's already shown us he  likes a good fight. So if you don't  want to watch, I'll call you when it's  done.

I want to watch. Smokey re-enters the ring, carrying some rope. He talks  briefly to Tom. Pilgrim, sensing something, turns and run the far side of the ring. Tom, his arms spread, walks ove to him, keeping him by the fence. Tom takes him by the  bridle. Smokey comes beside him. Tom unhitches the bridle in its place slips a rope halter Smokey passes to him.  Smokey then hands him two long ropes, one at a time. Tom  fastens one under the halter and ties the other to the sa horn. Tom asks Smokey.

You got that soft rope? Smokey hands it to him. Tom quietly talks to Pilgrim, run his hand down Pilgrim's left foreleg and lifts his hoof.  Pilgrim slightly shifts. And when he's still, Tom slips t loop at the end of the soft rope over the hoof making sur it's snug. And taking the other end of the rope, he hoist weight of Pilgrim's raised hoof and ties the rope to the  saddle horn. Pilgrim stands on three legs -- an explosion waiting to happen. Tom moves away from Pilgrim, taking th halter line from Smokey. Pilgrim, trying to move, finds h crippled. Scared, he lurches, hopping on his right forele Seeing he can't walk, panicked, he tries to run. Tom and  Smokey, brace themselves, lean back on their ropes and fo him around them in a tight circle. He goes around and aro like a crazed rocking horse with a broken leg. Tom looks and sees Annie has left Robert outside the ring to stand an anguished Grace -- her hands on her shoulders, grippin her. Robert watches, feeling too much a foreigner...
What is he doing this?

It'll be OK, Grace. But even Frank isn't so sure. Pilgrim, covered in sweat,  still circles. As he runs, his hobbled foot jabs at the a trying to find peace. He runs and runs as Tom and Smokey on the ropes -- until he can't run any more and stops. To Smokey let the lines go slack. Pilgrim, stands there, his sides heaving, panting like an asthmatic, making loud ras sounds. Tom and Smokey speak. Smokey hands him his rope.  Turning, he gets a coiled lasso out of the sand. He swing the rope in a wide loop and makes it fall over Pilgrim's  saddle horn. He pulls it tight. And he takes the other en the rope to the far side of the fence and ties it in a qu release knot to the bottom rung. Coming back he takes the other two lines from Tom. Tom crosses to the rail. He sta putting pressure on the rope. Pilgrim feeing it, braces  himself. The pressure tilts the saddle hold downward.
(to Grace and Annie)

He's trying to get him to go down  on his knees... Pilgrim fights. Tom pulls on the rope. Pilgrim, slowly,  begrudgingly, gives ground. Tom, brings him to his knees, but it is short lived. Pilgrim is muscling his way back t his feet. Tom pulls him down to his knees again. Pilgrim, fighting with every bit of strength, slowly gets to his f again. But the pressure Tom is putting on the saddle is t strong and relentless and finally Pilgrim goes down on hi knees and stays down. Yet Tom keeps the pressure on... To shouts to Smokey.
Drop the lines and come help me... Smokey, dropping the line, runs over. They both pull on  the saddle rope.

That's enough! Stop it! Pilgrim snorts and foams at the mouth, fighting. But  slowly, like a wounded bird, she starts giving in. He  rolls over on his side and lays his head in the sand and  is still. It seems like a total, humiliating surrender.  Grace starts to sob, burying her face in Annie's chest.  Robert feels impotent to help.
Tom and Smokey stand over the fallen horse like two big  game hunters at the carcass of a kill.

GRACE! Will you come here, please! Grace shakes her head "NO." Frank motions to Annie for  her to let Grace go... to let stand alone... We see  that it's not easy for Annie to trust this, but she does. And she steps back to where Robert stands... Tom, his face set, walks toward Grace...
Grace, I need you to come with me. Grace violently shakes her head "NO"... Robert gets up th courage to say aloud:
Well maybe she shouldn't be here... Annie quickly turns to him and says with quick intensity:

Robert! Let him handle it! Please! Robert can't watch this. He turns and takes a few steps.  Just stops... standing behind and apart from Annie, to  just watch... slowly becoming transfixed, like someone  who can't stop staring at an accident. Tom reaches Grace and puts his hand tenderly on her shoul
Grace, I need you to come with me.
No, you're only going to hurt him  some more.
He's not hurt. He's okay. Look at him.
(turned away)
No!
Grace, Listen... you've got to do this.  Just trust me one more time. Grace looks into his eyes and is reminded of all this man has done for her... and she remembers her trust.
Do what? Tom, prouder of her now than ever before.

I'll show you. Tom leads her across the ring, with his arm around her  shoulder. Annie tries to maintain her composure. Robert  remains still and focused. Tom and Grace come to Pilgrim, lying in the dirt, his  breathing plaintive. Tom speaks gently;
I want you to lay down with him. I  want you to stroke him. I want to  start with his hindquarters and rub  him, feel him all over. Grace is shaking her head "NO." He speaks more firmly.

Grace, you've got to do what I say. Grace knows there's no way out. She takes a breath and sl kneels in the dirt beside him, with Tom's help. She lays him, rubbing him, his hindquarters, his legs, his side,  softly rubbing his neck and the wet silky side of his hea
Now, listen. I want you to stand on  him.
What?! Tom responds to their voice without looking at them:
(they stop)

Grace, do what I'm telling you. Stand  on him... now! Grace obeys him through her tears. She lets Tom take her and guide her up onto the curve of Pilgrim's belly. Then lets go. Grace stands there with teas steaming down her  face -- standing on the animal she loved most in the worl
It's so cruel.
No. He had the choice.
What choice!!?

Either fight the way things are or  accept it. Robert, however, is hypnotized by the event. He is having private epiphany of sorts. Grace sits in the dirt by Pilgrim and strokes him quietly she begins talking to him, the way Tom does. Tom watches, he cautiously steps further away. Pilgrim looks up at Gra out of the dark pool of his one sad eye. They look at eac other. And we understand there's a connection once more. moment of understanding... and forgiveness. Grace starts to untie his ropes. Smokey is about to stop but Tom shakes "NO"... Pilgrim, like an infant coming out of the water, breathin life for the first time, gets to his feet. Grace and him to each other. And all is still. Grace grabs the saddle horn. Pilgrim shuffles as if he's  going to bolt. Grace quietly reassures him... She then  carefully puts her prosthetic leg in the stirrup. Pilgrim shifts slightly. Annie covers her mouth so as not to scre out her fear. Robert breaths heavily. They watch as Grace swings her leg, determined, and pulls herself into the  saddle. Sitting on his back, Pilgrim tosses his head and  looks as he's going to run off. But Grace puts her arms  around his neck, and once again, quietly reassures him. She starts to ride him, slowly, her arms around his neck, talking all the while, around the ring. Annie laughs as she cries -- emotion overwhelming her. Ro feels almost numb with fascination, gratitude, confusion. The slow ride turns into a trot... then a lope... then a  canter... round and round the ring. Frank and Diane smile Diane looks to Tom and knows what he's feeling... Tom watches as any father would -- his heart pounding wit pride for the miracle of his child. But he doesn't let on a second. Grace brings Pilgrim to a stop, lifts her arms to the  heavens, victorious. Everyone cheers. Smokey helps her of the horse. She stops to look at Tom, who busies himself w picking up the ropes... So she re-focuses on her parents. run to each other and embrace... First, she and Annie... she and her father... But, as Robert and Grace hold each other and begins to ex Annie manages to make eye contact with Tom... and tell hi with one look, how grateful she is... and how much she lo him. And he receives it...

head_text.subj: WE FOLLOW THE DAYS AFTER THIS EVENT...

text: Work on the ranch goes on as usual while Tom and Grace ke nurturing Pilgrim back to life.
Grace and Annie go riding...

Robert takes an isolated hike up the mountain until he co upon a ridge overlooking an inspiring vista. We can tell  Robert is moved by the sight. Sweaty, tired, he find a pl to sit... to be still... and to consider his life.

Frank's car is parked up for the trip to the airport that will take the Bookers to Branton, Missouri for Diane's  cousin's wedding... Grace, Annie and Robert are outside saying goodbye to the Bookers; Diane, the Twins... and Joe... Joe awkwardly sha her hand... then removes his hat and puts it on her head. Everyone laughs. They want to hug each other, but don't k if they would... Frank and Tom are packing the car...
Oh Frank, don't forget the wedding  present -- it's behind the door in  the laundry room. (to Robert and Annie)
I got her a pasta maker from the  catalogue... Not that they'll know  what to do with it in Branton,  Missouri... Probably use it as a  planter.
Diane!
(whispers)
Frank's touchy about his cousins. (they laugh)
Well, it was nice to meet you, Mr.  MacLean.
Same here, Mrs. Booker. Thank you  again for all your kindness.
Ah... Diane turns to Annie. Robert instinctively steps away, sa goodbye to Joe and the boys... The two women look at each other with respect and concern.
Now, are you sure you want to drive  that horse back yourself? There are  plenty of people 'round here who do  that sort of thing.
I already know the way... and it's  not like I have a job I have to rush  home for. (Diane nods)
Between you and me, I could use the  time alone. Diane understands.
And you'll be all right by yourself  here, (referring to Robert and Grace)
after they've gone? Tom hears this bit of info as he passes by with the weddi present and puts it in the truck. Annie makes sure to ave her look.
It's just one night. If I get  uncomfortable, I'll go over to  Hanks.
(double meaning)
Promise?
Promise. Diane just nods, knowingly. She extends her hand. The wom shake.
Good luck to you, Annie.
You too, Diane. They part. Diane starts giving order as she gets in the c
All right, everybody in. Frank, we  all set... Camera wides as we hear the voices of departure... see th MacLeans waving... See Tom off by himself, waving... but  thinking of something else...
In the midst of packing, Annie has made dinner for Grace Robert. In the midst of eating, Robert asks:
Shouldn't we have invited Tom over?
I did. He said he had work to do  until late. Annie remains silent.
Tom exits with a small, leather satchel. He crosses to hi truck, tosses in the satchel, gets in and drives off.
Grace enters the barn to say goodbye to Pilgrim.
She moves to his stall and opens the doors. He stands the without any fear of her. She smiles and enters. She wraps arm around his neck, pets him and whispers.
I'll see you home... OK?
Everything is being packed up. Robert is dressed for trav Annie is taping up the boxes containing her computer  equipment.
Are you going to stay in the city or  go up to Connecticut?
Connecticut. I told the office I'd  work out of there next week. When are  you planning to start back?
Probably first thing in the morning.  It's too late to start now. I'm going  to try not to do too much driving in  the dark.
May I have a suggestion?
Yeah, what?
Take your time.
(innocently)
What do you mean? Annie looks up from the box to see Robert is calmly stari at her. His demeanor is different. Something's going on.
You look like something's wrong. This is Robert's moment. He knows it. He takes a breath a hopes it comes out right:
I'll tell you something, Annie -- I  stood there looking at what was  happening to that horse... And, I  swear, it felt like the same thing  was happening to me.
I don't understa-
(continues)
And I have two choices. I can either  fight the way things are, or accept  them. (Annie waits; he smiles)

See, I always knew I loved you more.  Didn't bother me. I always felt  lucky... a little amazed... that such  a vibrant, beautiful woman would want  to be with a man like me... And I  guess I thought as long as I did  everything right -- if I was the best  husband I could be, the best father...  even being a good lawyer only mattered  to me because of what it meant for  us... if I could do all that, it  wouldn't make any difference if we  loved each other the same or not...  I wasn't asking for more. I told myself  I didn't need more. (smiles)
But you don't know how you feel about  me. You don't know... if you want a  life with me anymore... (bravely)
And I don't want you to come home  until you do know... (the hard part)

... one way or the other. Annie cannot remember a time when she ever loved her husb more than in this moment -- knowing what it took for him say this. She would not disrespect it with denials. Her  throat is choked with tears, she swallows down. She nods. Robert nods, feeling both pride and heartbreak in the sam moment. He picks up his bag, kisses her goodbye and exits
Annie and Robert walk towards the car to find Grace, lean against it -- looking depressed.
What's the matter, honey? Gonna miss  Pilgrim?
Tom's gone. Both Robert and Annie are surprised.
Smokey told me he left last night to  look at some horses in Sheriden. He  won't be back for three days. I can't  believe he didn't want to say goodbye.
(hiding her own distress)

Well... honey... you know... that's  just not his way. Maybe you can write  him a letter or something. Say thank  you... Don't think about it... You  take care and I'll see you home. She embraces Grace and, over her shoulder, watches Robert enter the car. Grace follows suit. The car drives off lea Annie alone at the Double Divide.
The ranch is still. Annie stands on the porch, her arms  folded, vulnerable, looking at the ranch. All her boxes a packed and stacked in the room. She looks over to the Ran House... to Tom's window.

A light goes on. Annie enters, cautiously. She's never be in this room. She crosses to the desk, touches it. She  notices a tape player and pushes it on. MUSIC PLAYS... Sh sees a small framed photo -- of Tom's son, years ago. Suddenly, she feels like an intruder. She shuts the music and exits...
Annie faces Pilgrim... she gently lifts her hand and care his face. He returns her gentleness. Annie is remembering Robert's words, her heart is heavy with conflict. She jok
Why do I get the feeling you know  what I should do, but you're not  telling me? She hears a truck pull up... Then, a door open and close. heart races...

I won't apologize for this. And I  won't hide it. Not for anybody.
I won't ask you to. He takes her in his arms and they kiss.

text: Tom and Annie, their horses packed with gear, ride across high mountain pasture through the grazing cattle...

Annie and Tom sit overlooking a breathtaking view. Tom is showing her the rope trick... She looks down at their tou fingers and he gently pulls the rope away, still knotted, without ever breaking their touch... Annie looks into his eyes, understanding what this means, raises his hand to h mouth and kisses it. She looks up at him with a curious  expression;
Show me again.
Annie!
One more time.

Annie lays asleep in Tom's arms, under a blanket. He pick another blanket with his free hand and shimmies it under head, laying her down. She snuggles with the blanket and  keeps sleeping. Tom takes a moment to look at her as she sleeps, gently  brushing her hair away from her eyes. He's deeply in love with this woman and wants to keep her with him. But there a sad resignation in his look. A confusion. He rises and walks to a stream nearby. He bends down to t some water when he hears something. He looks up and sees the other side: A WILD HORSE giving birth to a foal in the tall grass. An WHITE STALLION steps in between Tom and the mare, as if  protecting her. Tom rises slowly to his feet. Then stands stock still. He the Stallion penetrate each other. Suddenly this beautiful, powerful Stallion rears -- viole Tom remains still, but clearly the horse is treating him an invader... It's as if the Whisperer is now being guided by the Horse towards understanding. As Tom receives it, he remembers;
Summers are short here, Annie. There  isn't much of a fall. Before you know  it, the roads are closed... the nights  get long.

text: I don't care! We'd be together.
Two people can't just be alone together  in the world. At least not us...
I can't do this. I can't leave you... Voice-Overs have carried over into a...

I won't. But there is a difference in their lovemaking. There's a  slowness, a reverence... a sense of two people so bounded they are outside of time... Their love is so strong it al feels like despair -- their need to connect has gone beyo their bodies and into their spirits, for which there is n earthly satisfaction.
The sun has risen.

Annie awakens in bed and discovers she is alone. She look around for Tom. She rises and enters the other room to  discover: All her boxes and all her luggage have been removed. Her heart sinks. Tom re-enters, fully dressed, to get the last box. He sees on her face a look of confusion and hur
I figured, whenever you decided to  go, you'd be all set.
(curt)
How thoughtful of you. And what if  I decide not to go? Tom doesn't know how to respond. He looks away and bends to reach for the box when Annie commands:
Leave me alone! Beat. They stand awkwardly for a moment, until;
(pleadingly)
Annie, please... Tom reaches to embrace her, but Annie attacks him. Punchi his chest... pulling at his shirt as Tom tries to put his arms around her...
Tom's heart is breaking as he manages to get his arms aro her and hold her... as she breaks down and softly, the ra passes... Annie speaks softly.
(struggling)
I don't know any other way, Annie.
(more adamant)
Why? Suddenly;
You think this is easy for me!? Annie is struck by the powerful sincerity of his words;

It's just happened this way sometimes.  I can't explain it. But I look at you  and see Grace and I see Robert, and  no matter what you decide about him,  I just know this is right. Your life  isn't here and you know it. Annie looks into his eyes and asks, softly defiant;
Then what have we been doing? I mean  what was the point?
(confused by her question)
The point was to love each other.
Why? As if there has to be a result... Tom looks at her and sa with an almost innocent conviction:

Because we had to... And I'll never  stop loving you, Annie. Here. Where  my life is. The simplicity, and truth, of it hits Annie strongly. Annie releases herself from him and turns away... despond Realizing the utter truth and inevitability of what he sa She starts shaking her head. Tom can't hear it... He reac for her;
Annie... She turns back into his arms and they kiss passionately.. holding each other... as if for the last time.

Sure. I'll saddle them up. He exits. Not seeing the tears in Annie's eyes.
